text:
Today, the Subcommittee for Indigenous Peoples of the U.S. took historic steps to address the epidemic of missing and murdered women in Native American communities. It's the 1st time the House has held a hearing on this important issue.

My opening statement:
#MMIW #SilentCrisispic.twitter.com/ePf9bjx58t

html: We need to work in partnership with the communities who have been struck by these tragedies in order to find real-world, tangible solutions to this epidemic and end this cycle of violence.

html: There are currently three ways for tribes to receive federal recognition. H.R. 3744 would make Congress the ONLY body that can recognize tribes. This will cause delays and make it harder for tribes to be recognized.

H.R. 3744 would make Congress the ONLY body that can recognize tribes.
 
This will cause delays and make it harder for tribes to be recognized.
